still apportion including conveyors, crankshaft grinders and others which, on account of lack of requirements or being in poor condition, remains in BES yard waiting to be disposed of.
IV. For the excess machineries , under Non-project type re- cently arrived, about one third has either been allocated to Government enterprises or auctioned to private industries. It is expected that the rest will be disposed of in a rea- sonably short time.
A report on the status of Excess Property arrivals and dis- posal as of February 15, 1962 has been forwarded to you and further reports will be forwarded monthly for your reference.
112) CORY
Sincerely yours,
C. C. Chang Acting Secretary General
cc: Mr. J.D.Martin, MSM/C BES 2D 3D SY/psh

IV. For the excess machineries , under Non-project type re- cently arrived, about one third has either been allocated to Government enterprises or auctioned to private industries. It is expected that the rest will be disposed of in a rea- sonably short time.
